title: (x) Old t shirt fonts - various {gang}
content:
hi Im looking for some fonts similar   
to this one (super) [http://images.webmagic.com/klov.com/images/S/mSuper\_Pac-Man.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20120623005633/http:/images.webmagic.com/klov.com/images/S/mSuper_Pac-Man.jpg)   
   
or if you can remember on old tshirt when you put your name on the back, its like the font they used for the credits in cheers   
   
It does have to be that one but does someone know a place to look for these styles?   
   
Thanks again   
   
Ian
author: anonymous

comments.content:
The PAC-MAN font appears to be a modification of a typeface   
that appears in the Solotype catalog as Guggenheim Shaded.   
I don't find it digitized anywhere by that name. Check [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20120623005633/http:/www.dafont.com/en/search.php?nq=1&q=pacman) for   
two suitable fonts.
I just found out that Cooper Black actually _is_ one of the two faces used for credits in Cheers...

Fontalicious do Pac Font and plenty of fonts suitable for old t-shirts   
 [http://www.fontalicious.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20120623005633/http:/www.fontalicious.com/)
Pacman is probably had drawn but I think someone made it into a font. Try DaFonts

[Cooper Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20120623005633/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/cooper-black/) and [Goudy MT](http://web.archive.org/web/20120623005633/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/goudy-mt/) are quite similar to the font used in Cheers...   
   
You might also wanna take a look at [Cabaret](http://web.archive.org/web/20120623005633/http:/www.myfonts.com/Search?searchtext=Cabaret)   
   
:-)
